item.title: Elbow, Peter - 'About Voice and Writing'
item.description: One Liner Explores voice, in five different forms, in writing as something that is chosen and enacted as well as an authentic individual experience in writing to present voice as a practical tool with careful considerations. Summary In the introduction to this collection, first explores three major debates about voice–discourse as text vs. voice, ethos as virtue/appearance of virtue, self vs. role, –. He then responds to these debates by illustrating how they don’t need to be resolved in either/or binary terms, and that a careful consideration of voice has some useful and noncontroversial applications when applied to writing.
